meanings.sent1: Every morning, the alarm clock helps me reawaken from my slumber.
meanings.sent2: After a short nap, she will reawaken feeling refreshed and energized.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat will reawaken with a big stretch and a yawn.
meanings.sent4: As the sun rises, the city begins to reawaken with bustling activity.
meanings.sent5: The flowers reawakened with the arrival of spring, blooming in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: To revive from sleep or inactivity.
meanings.sent1: A cup of coffee in the morning helps reawaken my senses.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise outside caused him to reawaken abruptly from his nap.
meanings.sent3: The smell of freshly baked cookies can reawaken even the deepest sleeper.
meanings.sent4: The music festival aims to reawaken the spirit of the town after a long winter.
meanings.sent5: The motivational speech was able to reawaken their enthusiasm for the project.
